output:
As I went down to see my old love one more time I thought again
Of all the times we had to talk about our dates but we failed
I've given most of my time to a job and to mundanities
And now it's lit I fear, I'm slowly decaying by degrees
According to what I see there is no sense There is not much to say, there is no evidence
That life is no wasteland of broken down dreams As far as the eye can see
We had such high hopes and we had money to spend There was a world to gauge just there on the bend
There were fields of gold, valleys of milk and honey As far as the eye can see
So day by day our blood, our bones, our strength Our belief, our faith in God
Got slowly deconstructed, eroded and turned into mud
It's now that we decide to give up faith and courage all the way
It's just a point of view, get blurred a little more day by day
According to what I see there is no sense There is not much to say, there is no evidence
That life is no wasteland of broken down dreams As far as the eye can see
We had such high hopes and we had money to spend There was a world to gauge just there on the bend
There were fields of gold, valleys of milk and honey As far as the eye can see
Think about all those who died for no reason Would you still say it's a wonderful life?
If there is one thing to say about mankind There is nothing kind about men
Oh Lord protect me from those who speak your name They're the most likely to kill me someday
I don't believe you go to heaven when you go Everything goes to hell anyway
And according to what I see there is no sense There is not much to say, there is no evidence
That life is no wasteland of broken down dreams As far as the eye can see
We had such high hopes and we had money to spend There was a world to gauge just there on the bend
There were fields of gold, valleys of milk and honey As far as the eye can see
So now I guess I'd better remain silent I'm gone anyway
But please beware of your dreams They will make your hair turn to grey
